prompt: What is the utility allowance for a 2-bedroom unit with natural gas heating in Bozeman, Montana?
response: According to the Montana Department of Commerce's 2025 utility allowance schedule, a 2-bedroom unit in Bozeman with natural gas heating has an estimated monthly allowance of $61 for heating. Additional allowances apply for other utilities such as cooking and water heating. [Source: Montana Department of Commerce](https://commerce.mt.gov/_shared/housing/RentalHousing/docs/UtilitySchedules/2025/Region-161.pdf)

prompt: Does the Housing Authority of Billings offer a local preference for applicants experiencing homelessness?
response: Yes, the Housing Authority of Billings has adopted a local preference for individuals and families experiencing homelessness, allowing up to 30 applicants to receive priority on the Housing Choice Voucher waiting list. [Source: Housing Authority of Billings](https://homefrontpartners.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/Homeless-pref.-referral-HCV.pdf)

prompt: What are the 2023 income limits for a family of four in Montana?
response: For 2023, the income limits for a family of four in Montana are as follows: Extremely Low Income (30% AMI): $25,600; Very Low Income (50% AMI): $42,700; Low Income (80% AMI): $68,350. [Source: Montana Budget & Policy Center](https://montanabudget.org/report/pb_housingvoucher_program)

prompt: How does portability work for a voucher holder in Montana moving to another county?
response: In Montana, a voucher holder can transfer their Housing Choice Voucher to another county, provided the receiving Public Housing Authority (PHA) administers the program. The originating PHA coordinates with the receiving agency to ensure all necessary paperwork is completed. [Source: Montana Department of Commerce](https://commerce.mt.gov/Housing/Rental-Assistance/Portability/Port-In)
